184119719.review:
Review: Dragon Saga (formerly known as Dragonica)

Dragon Saga, or Dragonica as it was called back in the day, was a huge part of my gaming youth. I spent countless hours playing it, and it holds a lot of nostalgic value for me. However, revisiting it after all these years was honestly disappointing. The game hasn't evolved at all in over 14 years.

Everything is still the same: the graphics, the gameplay, and unfortunately, even the bugs and crashes. It feels like no effort was made to modernize or improve it, and that's just sad. What made it worse is the tiny player base – Steam charts show only around 46 concurrent players online. For an MMORPG, that’s just not enough to make it feel alive.

Playing it again was a nostalgic trip, but also a clear reminder of why I already said goodbye back in 2014 when the EU servers shut down. I think it’s time to let the game rest. Either shut it down or sell the rights to a studio that can rebuild it or create a renewed version that fits today’s gaming standards.

Dragon Saga deserves to be remembered as a great part of the past, not as a zombie game limping on for a few more years.

[i]P.S.: Don’t let my Steam hours fool you – I spent thousands of hours back in the gPotato days.[/i]
